üßæ Accounting KPIs: 
- **Debt-to-Equity Ratio** 
    - Formula: Total Liabilities / Total Equity 
    - Data Collection: Balance sheet (internal data) 

- **Invoice Processing Time** 
    - Formula: Number of Days from Invoice Receipt to Payment 
    - Data Collection: Internal invoice tracking and accounts payable systems (internal data) - **Working Capital Ratio** - Formula: Current Assets / Current Liabilities - Data Collection: Balance sheet (internal data) - **Net Profit Margin** - Formula: (Net Profit / Revenue) x 100% - Data Collection: Income statement (internal data) - **Return on Equity** - Formula: Net Income / Average Shareholder's Equity - Data Collection: Income statement and balance sheet (internal data) - **Gross Profit Margin** - Formula: (Gross Profit / Revenue) x 100% - Data Collection: Income statement (internal data) - **Accounts Receivable Turnover** - Formula: Net Credit Sales / Average Accounts Receivable - Data Collection: Income statement and balance sheet (internal data) - **Fixed Asset Turnover** - Formula: Net Sales / Average Net Fixed Assets - Data Collection: Balance sheet and income statement (internal data) - **Accounts Payable Turnover** - Formula: Total Supplier Purchases / Average Accounts Payable - Data Collection: Internal accounts payable system and income statement (internal data) - **Inventory Turnover** - Formula: Cost of Goods Sold / Average Inventory - Data Collection: Balance sheet and income statement (internal data)

üí∞ Cash KPIs: - **Operating Cash Flow** - Formula: Net Income + Non-Cash Expenses + Changes in Working Capital - Data Collection: Income statement and changes in balance sheet accounts (internal data) - **Days Payables Outstanding** - Formula: (Accounts Payable / Cost of Sales) x 365 - Data Collection: Internal accounts payable system and cost of sales from income statement (internal data) - **Average Days Delinquent** - Formula: (Total Days Late / Number of Late Payments) - Data Collection: Internal accounts receivable aging data (internal data) - **Days Sales Outstanding** - Formula: (Accounts Receivable / Total Credit Sales) x 365 - Data Collection: Internal accounts receivable system and total credit sales from income statement (internal data) - **Days of Inventory Outstanding** - Formula: (Average Inventory / Cost of Goods Sold) x 365 - Data Collection: Internal inventory management system and cost of goods sold from income statement (internal data) - **Cash Burn Rate** - Formula: Cash Spent / Time Period - Data Collection: Cash flow statement or cash accounting (internal data) - **Free Cash Flow** - Formula: Operating Cash Flow - Capital Expenditures - Data Collection: Cash flow statement and capital expenditure records (internal data) - **Cash Conversion Cycle** - Formula: Days Inventory Outstanding + Days Sales Outstanding - Days Payables Outstanding - Data Collection: Data from internal systems for inventory, receivables, and payables (internal data) - **Cash Reserves in Days** - Formula: (Cash and Cash Equivalents / Daily Operating Expenses) - Data Collection: Balance sheet and average daily operating expenses (internal data) - **Overdues Ratio** - Formula: (Overdue Invoices / Total Invoices) x 100% - Data Collection: Internal accounts receivable aging data (internal data)

üë®‚Äçüíº CEO KPIs: - **Revenue Growth** - Formula: (Current Period Revenue - Prior Period Revenue) / Prior Period Revenue - Data Collection: Income statement (internal data) - **Market Share** - Formula: (Company's Sales Revenue / Total Sales of Industry) x 100% - Data Collection: Sales data (internal data) and industry sales data (external data, such as from market research reports) - **Employee Productivity** - Formula: Output / Number of Employees - Data Collection: Output and employee data (internal data) - **Innovation Index** - Formula: New Products Launched / Total Products - Data Collection: New product launch data and total product data (internal data) - **Brand Equity** - Formula: Depends on the organization's definition. Could be financial, brand strength, and consumer-based assessments - Data Collection: Market research, customer surveys, and financial data (combination of internal and external data) - **Market Expansion** - Formula: New Markets Entered / Total Market Opportunities - Data Collection: Data on new markets entered and total market opportunities (internal and possibly external data) - **Sustainability Metrics** - Formula: Depends on the organization's definition, e.g., Reduction in CO2 Emissions - Data Collection: Data on environmental impacts (internal data and possibly regulatory data) - **Employee Engagement** - Formula: Can be measured using surveys, feedback sessions, etc. - Data Collection: Results from employee surveys and feedback sessions (internal data) - **Employee Turnover** - Formula: (Number of Employees who have left / Average number of Employees) x 100% - Data Collection: HR data (internal data) - **Cash Flow** - Formula: Net Income + Depreciation & Amortization + Change in Working Capital - Data Collection: Cash flow statement (internal data)

üíº Investors KPIs: - **Earnings per Share** - Formula: (Net Income - Dividends on Preferred Stock) / Average Outstanding Shares - Data Collection: Income statement and balance sheet (internal data) - **Quick Ratio** - Formula: (Cash and Cash Equivalents + Marketable Securities + Accounts Receivable) / Current Liabilities - Data Collection: Balance sheet (internal data) - **Dividend Payout Ratio** - Formula: Dividends / Net Income - Data Collection: Income statement and dividend records (internal data) - **Current Ratio** - Formula: Current Assets / Current Liabilities - Data Collection: Balance sheet (internal data) - **Return on Investment** - Formula: (Gain from Investment - Cost of Investment) / Cost of Investment - Data Collection: Investment gain and cost data (internal data) - **Share Buyback Ratio** - Formula: Number of Shares Repurchased / Total Shares Outstanding - Data Collection: Share buyback and outstanding shares data (internal data) - **Price-to-Earnings Ratio** - Formula: Market Value per Share / Earnings per Share - Data Collection: Market data and earnings data (combination of internal data and market data) - **Gross Margin Ratio** - Formula: (Total Revenue -- Cost of Goods Sold) / Total Revenue - Data Collection: Income statement (internal data) - **Dividend Yield** - Formula: Annual Dividends per Share / Price per Share - Data Collection: Dividend records and share price data (internal data and possibly market data)
